Reviews.Title: “Helpful and lovely area”
Reviews.Author: Aced_up
Reviews.Content: Staff are very helpful. Each time we came back to the hotel, they had our key ready before we pressed the doorbell. We had a problem with the toliet float mechanism which couldnt be fixed until the next day, so they gave us a different room that was available. They suggested the option as a solution! Even though we had the breakfast option, we did not wake up early enough. 2 minutes walk from Paddington station, plenty of eateries nearby. The Hyde Park Stables are nearby if you fancy a ride around Hyde Park!

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay with ease of access to the City”
Reviews.Author: Lakerat789
Reviews.Content: We initially booked here as my sister was going to be having a baby at St. Mary's hospital. We found the rooms clean (if not somewhat tiny compared to what I've become accustomed to in the US - and we do mean TINY), adequately furnished for our needs and comfortable even with 2 large suitcases dominating the floor. The staff were polite, and friendly. I can't comment on the quality of the breakfast as we preferred the "Lite Bite" on the corner of London St. And Norfolk Square - where we could sit and watch the world go by. The only drawback was the noise pollution from other rooms - most notable at breakfast - it was very easy to hear the opening and closing of doors and people talking in the corridors outside. On more positive notes, the closeness to Paddington is a must - there's a very reasonable Curry House (Murghuls..sp?) at the end of the road - although their service is a little poor - but the food makes up for that. Also 2 decent pubs at the end of the road. For a 4 day stay in London it was perfect for our needs, a good base and although a little pricier than we really wanted to pay - with so many hotels of this type in the Paddington area being hit or miss - I am happy to say we got a positive result. Would def consider staying there again if the

Reviews.Title: “Typical Norfolk Square budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: OmanSusan
Reviews.Content: The Belvedere is pretty much the same as the other budget hotels in Norfolk Square. By that I mean steep, narrow staircases, tiny room, tiny bathroom, furnishings old but clean, clean sheets on an almost comfortable mattress and a simple breakfast. The price did seem a bit high compared to the others in its class. The location is excellent if you are traveling to and from Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “An adult hostel”
Reviews.Author: norbafreund
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location near Paddington Station, I could not find reasons to be very happy. The price was salty for what it was, breakfast greasy and english student style. Service was average only with good will. Rule were strict and definately derived from bad experiences. When asked to use the phone available in the room, I was asked when I was suppose to leave. Upon stating it was in the following day , suddenly the line was not " in order" .Payment was in advance, which probably confirms that management is worried about defaulting guests

Reviews.Title: “Just ok for a night's halt...not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tortter
Reviews.Content: Well if you are looking for a place just to spend the night and looking for a central location, this hotel will suit you. the rooms are very very small. Just enough to accomodate a single bed. No room service or any facilities. Good thing was that the room was clean and hygenic. They dont even serve you drinking water. When i asked for it, they said either i need to buyt it from outside or use the tap water coming in the bathroom. This place is run by a pakistani national and is a very friendly guy. Bottom line if you choose to stay at this hotel, dont expect anything at all.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, shabby "B and B"”
Reviews.Author: Ann M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights and found the experience quite unpleasant. Firstly, the hotel doesn't have a lift and we had to carry our bags up four flights of a narrow and increasingly steep stairs, The room itself, while small, was clean and we were given fresh towels every day. The bathroom, though, was a different matter. It was too small and the water spills out into the bedroom when you take a shower. The breakfast is good and the waiting staff are friendly and efficient. However the breakfast room is too small so guests must wait their turn to enter in the morning. Perhaps if breakfast ran for another 30 minutes this would not be a problem. The worst thing about this hotel are the owners, a couple of Indian men. They are the most unfriendly, unhelpful people I've ever met. They couldn't ( or wouldn't ) help with simple directions or give advice about local transport or restaurants. One of the men was also quite rude to us when we inquired about left luggage facilities on our last day in London. Another thing we didn't like was being asked to pay in full as soon as we arrived. Is this standard practice for hotels in London? We're used to hotels taking our visa card details on arrival and paying as we check out. This hotel is centrally located but I'm sure there are better and more reasonably priced hotels in the area. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: MrsL84
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located in a lovely spot in Paddington. Easy access to tube and train stations, it is set within a lovely green. However, do not let the online ad and other reviews persuade you to stay. We were given a 'cupboard'! Room 6! which accommodated a 3/4 bed, with a single wardrobe - bathroom that measured 4 foot by 4 foot (My husbands knees touched the door whilst sat on the toilet). The shower is only big enough to accommodate a 3 year old with a tray that measures 1/4 inch so as soon as you are in water spills onto the bathroom floor and out into the 'cupboard'. Noise from tourists/teenages/taxi's etc calm's down at 3:30am and then starts again at 5:30am with bin men/buses/deliveries - even on Sunday!!! Could not change room as there were no vacancies. Breakfast very nice and breakfast staff lovely. This did not make up for the hotel room. Do not know what other rooms were like as all other visitors were of different language and could not engage in conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Belvedere this week, and overall, was quite happy with it. I had a single room, on the top floor, up four flights of stairs, and there is no lift, but I was aware of that before I arrived. The room was small, as London rooms usually are, but was clean, and well furnished with a comfortable bed, desk and chair, small closet, and shelf containing kettle and tea/coffee. Nice flat screen TV on the wall. En suite bathroom was really tiny, but was good to have a private bathroom; for similar price in the past I have stayed in places with shared bathrooms. The bathroom was also very clean. No noise issues were noted, either from trains, window, or internal. Location is good, just around the corner from Paddington station. Breakfast was fine, only complaint here is the breakfast serving time, which finishes at 9am. Who gets up by 9am on the weekend when they are on vacation? Wish they would extend the breakfast hours until 10am... Overall, OK value, comfortable, and clean, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, no thanks.”
Reviews.Author: Flip_switch
Reviews.Content: This hotel has quite a bit of wear and tear. No elevators. If you are on the top floors, be prepared to lug that luggage up an increasingly tighter network of staircases. The blankets on the beds are really showing their use and age. There were several stains on ours and it was just more comfortable to kick them off and sleep with just the sheets. The bed was comfy though. The bathroom in the room was so odd. It's a mini bathroom pod. You cannot shower without getting absolutely everything wet and unless you towel dry the pod, it stays wet. You might as well stay in the rooms without an ensuite and share the common bathrooms. Breakfast was good. You get one egg, sausage, bacon, beans, toast, coffee/tea and jams. Typical English breakfast. Dinning room is a bit cramped but otherwise okay. Quick service for how busy they get. Location is great. Right down the block from Paddington Station. But there are numerous other similarly priced hotels in this area who have recently undergone upgrades to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “"Is this a hotel?"”
Reviews.Author: avy01
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in London in various places and this is by far the worst. The room was a rat run with the bed pushed against the wall and the bathroom was a pod with a sink toilet and shower in the same space. My idea of a hotel is somewhere you can get room service if you want to, this establishment only does bed and breakfast. We came home one evening to a bed which did not have a top sheet and we found it stuffed down the side of the bed and so had to make it ourselves. We had a great time in london and we will be going there again but deffinately not staying in this so called hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for gigs at Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: fransiclefalcini
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a gig at hyde park. It's a 15 to 20 minute walk to park lane, hyde park and only a 2 minute walk to Paddington station. We stayed in a quadruple room that had a double and 2 singles. The room was a good size for the price. The bathroom was very small but fine for one night, the shower was easy to get to the right temperature and quite powerful. Breakfast was good, you could have a full english or cereal and toast. Only negative was that it was very hot in the room so we had to have the window open which meant it was quite loud. But it was a hot summers day. This hotel is great value for money considering its location. I would recomend for a stay in london where you are out all day site seeing etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the central location”
Reviews.Author: shacra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for train travellers to the West End as Paddington Station is just round the corner. We were in town for a concert in Hyde Park Which was about 15 minutes away. The Belvedere is a fraction of the price of hotels closer to our destination venue. The reception desk is manned 24 hours so no need to worry about losing keys. The double room 19 is on the ground floor and of a good size. Being centrally located there is no view from the window but the room had excellent lighting. Everything was clean including the functional ensuite bathroom with shower. Complimentary tea & coffee are provided along with a hair dryer. As mentioned in other reviews there is a small rumble as trains pass by but this did not disturb us nearly as much as the collection of guests staying in adjoining room 20 on Friday who were definately night owls. Breakfast is a basic menu with all the standard offerings. Tea/coffee, cereal, orange juice and a cooked option: sausage, bacon, egg, mushroom, beans and plenty of toast. All served by some very cheerful staff. We could be picky & grumble about the cracked tile in the bathroom or the mattress coming towards the end of its life but when weighed against the price, we're not complaining. Overall this is a great hotel to stay at if you're on a budget. Conveniently located, clean and we weren't left hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but ok.”
Reviews.Author: Miukumauku
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Belvedere for 4 nights at the beginning of June 2011. I booked a twin and asked a quiet room on the upper floors based on the reviews saying there were noice from the tube going below the hotel. We got a room on the top floor, and I think it was actually a triple, so more spacious than most London budget hotels. The stairs were really narrow, so with a lot of luggage they can be a struggle. The top floor was quiet as promised, but you could hear the tube there as well, didn't bother our sleep tough. There was nothing really wrong about the hotel or the room, but everything was rather basic and shabby. The room and bathroom were clean but quite worn, they hadn't been renovated in ages. Sheets were clean but the beddings had stains in them and altought the room was cleaned daily, they didin't vacuum the carpet during our stay. The bathroom was tiny and so were the towels. I suggest if you have long hair, bring your own towel! The beds were rather hard and had definitely seen their best days a while ago! The breakfast was full english including (cold!) toast and cereals. I've had better, but it was all included, so no big complaints. The hotel staff was ok, not very friendly but not rude either. Overall a decent stay, but nothing special. If you book at the Belvedere, you don't have to worry about bugs or unsafety etc, but you'll get nothing extra either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptance budget lodging near Paddington”
Reviews.Author: LoveChicago
Reviews.Content: I booked my accomodations just shortly after Prince William & Kate announced their wedding date, all of the chain budget hotels were booked so I looked at places up near Paddington Station where I knew that there would be something available. They hadn't upped their prices for the wedding, either I booked too quickly or they simply aren't gougers. I was going to try Priceline just before the wedding but a friend ended up booking at the same place so I kept the reservation. I booked a single room but think I ended up with a double since my bed could have fit two reasonably sized people. My traveling companion ended up with a room on the ground level, I got room 10 which is up three flights of stairs, there is no elevator so if you are unable to climb stairs with your luggage I would contact the hotel before you book and make sure you can get a room on the ground floor. There were even more rooms higher than mine and there is no lift. There was a bit of noise from the street and you could hear the trains from Paddington on the ground floor. The walls were a bit thin but my neighbors weren't too noisy. The bathroom was also quite small, the water pressure in the shower was fine and there was plenty of hot water. The only toiletry that was provided was a bar of soap and a small towel. There was a hair dryer in the room and I believe they had an iron you could borrow. Breakfast was included in my rate and they gave you a full English breakfast with over easy eggs, toast, sausage, bacon and beans plus tea, coffee, juice and cereal. Most mornings I could sit down with no problem, if I couldn't then I headed out and grabbed something at the supermarket. My satisfied rating means that the hotel was exactly what I expected, a clean, basic, well located hotel. I wouldn't stay here or any of the other budget hotels in the area if Priceline bidding was an option but if I booked again during a busy period I would probably stay here again. The location was good for me, it's very convenient if traveling to from Heathrow and there is good tube connections at Paddington. The hotel is just a short walk from Paddington and even later at night I didn't feel uncomfortable returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ray076
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room for 5 nights and were pleasantly surprised by the high standard of this hotel. The reason that we choose the Belvedere was because of previous good reviews and I can confirm that they were acturate. The rooms and the hotel were clean and well maintained during our stay, the staff was helpful and friendly, the breakfast was adequate and the hotel was close to the tube and to Heathrow transport. For a hotel in this price range, I found it to be excellent and would have no hestitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled my booking without reason!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaz_UAE
Reviews.Content: Utterly unimpressive. The hotel cancelled my booking a week after accepting it and without reason, leaving me stranded. After hours of research on location and reviews, now I have to pay 50% more to find another close property. Hotels.com assisted in finding an alternative, but further away from the main train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: siiri81
Reviews.Content: Located conviniently close to the Paddington station and many bus stops. Hotel offer great English breakfast. Staff was polite and helpful. Bad sleepers should take along ear plugs as the noise from street and other rooms could disturb someone.

Reviews.Title: “Dont think twice - Book it now !”
Reviews.Author: Trevvyj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Belvedere for 3 nights over Easter with wife and 2 kids aged 8 and 13 Literally a 4 minute walk from Paddingtom underground. Arrived an hour early but got room straight away - Double bed with 2 singles for the Kids - Very Clean - Bathroom was small but spotless and recently renovated. - LCD TV in room and a Hairdryer. - No noise whatsoever (Room 7) guys at the reception were great - I noticed in an earlier review someone mentioned that they were scruffy etc - They Were just casually dressed and very polite - Reception was manned by the 2 guys 24hrs - Front door was locked at all times and the reception guys would let yhou in as soon as you buzzed - In fact they remembered our room number and had our key ready each time you come in. Breakfast was Perfect - Juice - Cereals - English Breakfast and Toast tea and coffee. A 10 minute walk to Hyde Park and the start of Oxford Street in nice surroundings - nearly all of the street the hotel was in were hotels so the area if very touristy at all hours and perfectly safe to walk in at night. - We are a family of four - and will book here without hesitation again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: Luanne8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend and it was very nice. The desk clerk especially was very personable and helpful. Right near the bus 23 stop, so you can see the sights as you go into the centre, or walk to Hyde park etc. Lots of great Indian and other Asian food in the neighbourhood. You can have breakfast really early, which is good as London is up early too: English Breakfast or cereal & toast. Keep in mind that, like many of the hotels in this area, this is a renovated historical building, so there is no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not great”
Reviews.Author: HNLTraveler44
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler who booked a single room, I had limited room choice - either the top floor, up 5 flights of narrow stairs or a room in the basement, a small cave like place. I opted for the "cave', which was generally okay except for the frequent sound of the Paddington station tube trains. Breakfast was okay, and the staff was fine. Did not like the fact they charge 5 pounds per bag to hold bags after checking out. Also, the cancellation policy requires over 48 hour notice, even after you have stayed a few nights. No Wi Fi was also annoying. Was good for access to the Tube, Paddington rail, and two good bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: doylebrian
Reviews.Content: as a retired couple we were somewhat apprehensive but pleasantly surprised warm clean and comfortable with very helpful staff. Very convenient for use as a base when visiting London would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: KJH21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family room (something no hotels have here in Canada but a brilliant idea!). The room had 2 double beds and a single--perfect for the 5 of us. The room was cleaned ok. There was some gunge that needed scrubbing between the sink and wall, the bedsheets were still rumpled despite duvets pulled up and bed supposedly "made"...you get the idea. Nothing major. The breakfast included in the price is AWESOME. It's a full English breakfast (translation: toast, eggs, baked beans, mushroom, bacon and sausage). If that doesn't fill you up, there is also a selection of cold cereals. Coffee, tea, juice and milk is also free-flowing. You can really fill up!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price for London”
Reviews.Author: Mrlove2travel
Reviews.Content: Booked a family room for a week in early January based on the hotel's location, price and reviews. Being just around the corner from Paddington tube/Heathrow express, with lots of options around for food and 5 minutes walk from Hyde Park, The Belvedere is in a great location to explore London. Depending on how energetic you are we walked all the way to the London Eye on one of the days. Our room was on the 3rd floor where the stairs get VERY narrow which made transporting luggage up and down very hard. There is no lift. Our room was good, everything we needed for our stay as we were only in there to sleep however the bathroom was very small. I had to dry myself in the bedroom as there wasn't enough space in the bathroom! Staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included and filled the gap. I would recommend this hotel, especially for people on a budget or for like us people who would just rather spend their money on the sites rather than the place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a budget hotel. Problem with holding luggage.”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan
Reviews.Content: Wanted an inexpensive hotel in London for 2 nights on our way to Africa. Picked this because it was convenient to Heathrow Express (about a 5 minute walk). Location was very good. In addition to easy tube access, it is only 1 block from the Big Bus tour drop-off (although the desk staff didn't know that when we asked). Room was small, but adequate. It is an old Victorian building, so stairs are steep and narrow. We had read about that and requested a room on the lowest floor, which we got (remember that the first floor is one floor up). Not too much space in room, but OK. However, because of uneven floor, the bed rolled when I sat down. The bathroom is definitely as others have described, although it reminded me of a bathroom on an airplane. No bigger, except for a small extension for a shower. In the shower, the handheld shower head holder was so high and faced the wall, so that you could only use the shower as handheld. Also, there was a big step up to get into the bathroom cubicle (it is all prefab), so you need to remember not to stub your toes at night. Also, there is only one towel per person provided. So hair and body were dried with the same towel. They did change the towels each day. Also one bar of soap to share between sink and shower (but you could reach the sink from the shower...). We had no problem with any noise. The breakfast was fine, although it would be very repetitive after more than a couple of mornings. There is a very good fish & chips house down the block called Sussex House. When we went to check out, however, we ran into a very strange charge. They wanted 5 British pounds per bag (including backpacks) to hold the luggage after 2 p.m. That's about $8 U.S. per bag. Our flight wasn't leaving until 8 p.m., and we intended to leave the the luggage until about 4 p.m. But the clerk was not going to give us any leeway. He said it was clearly stated in their policy. I reread the web site for the hotel and saw nothing. My husband finally got him to agree to 10 pounds (about $17.50), but this left us with a very bad taste. And the clerk complained that we left 4 bags (including the backpacks). We have traveled all over the world and have never had anyone charge us for holding luggage. Granted, they don't have a lot of space, and the luggage was stored in the corner of the hotel lounge (so you weren't even paying for security). When we left, we saw several other bags and could only wonder if those people were paying 5 pounds per bag. Anyway, add that cost to the price of the room if you have a late flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nemrac9
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor and booked it because of good reviews and I was not disappointed! I stayed for 3 nights. Yes, the rooms are small, very small (!), but it is really all you need. I stayed in a single room and could barely move, but it had everything I needed, very close to Paddington station with great tube & bus connections. Staff were always helpful and professional. The hotel is clean and the breakfast is good. I arrived past midnight on the first night due to the snow at the airport, but the night receptionist was very helpful. Unfortunately there was hardly any hot water, but I guess that was because a family arrival just before I arrived. The following days it was perfect. As other travelers mentioned, you can hear the tube, but you stay in London (!!) there will be some sort of noise everywhere. The bed could use a new mattress, but otherwise it was absolutely perfect and I would definitely use the hotel again for a short visit in London. I believe for the price I paid, I could not have gotten anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: orgasmicfun
Reviews.Content: The Belvedere Hotel, 52-54 Norfolk Square, Paddington, W2 1RT is an excellent hotel on every imaginable level. The premises are kept in pristine condition both of cleanliness and decoration. The staff are helpful and polite, nothing is too much trouble for them. The breakfast is well prepared and presented, a full English Breakfast with juice, cereal and toast all available in abundance served by cheerful, friendly staff in a clean well decorated breakfast room. The structure of the building is sound and well maintained, however the layout does not leave any room to install a lift so be prepared to climb some stairs. (The receptionist did offer assistance with my luggage). My only regret is that for much of my stay in London I was in another hotel (see my other post on this site). Well done to the management and staff of the Belvedere keep up the good work, I will be back and definitely recommend the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecctly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: wmb1
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing wrong at all with this hotel. You know when you book that you havent booked The Ritz, so if you dont go along with expectations of The Ritz you'll be fine. Easy to find, a minute or so from Paddington Underground, the staff were polite and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast (included) was fine and freshly cooked. The door to the kitchen was open from the dining room and I could clearly see that it was clean. There was a heating radiator in the rooom, but no air conditioning so cooling was by means of opening the window. This could be a problem in the height of summer with heat and noise but i was there in October so it was fine. Hairdrier, flat screen tv, telephone, tea and coffee making facilities, all good. I would normally stay at some no-frills chain like travel lodge because at least I know what I am getting. What I got here was comparable. The rooms are small, and the bathroom really struggles to even call itself a room. In fact the bathroom is a tiny, plastic, pre-fab cabin that I suspect has been retro-fitted into the corner of the room in order to call it en suite. Seriously, its so small you could sit on the toilet and take a shower at the same time (not that I was so inclined). This hotel is fine. It's functional. I wouldnt stay for any length of time unless I had received a really really great rate, but for a short business trip where all i needed was somewhere safe to sleep, i couldnt complain at all. I was on the first floor and did not hear the tube train noise that others here have suffered with.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annabeee3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room on the 4th floor with our 2 children. Although basic, it was clean, comfortable and quiet. . We arrived very late at night with two children and the night manager helped us carry our bags to the room. Great service. The breakfast was cereal, eggs, toast, beans, bacon and sausage (all perfectly edible but steer away from the sausage) tea, coffeee and orange juice. Very close to Paddington station. A good choice for a budget hotel in London

Reviews.Title: “Good, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalisburyMoonraker
Reviews.Content: I have been staying one or two nights a week at the Belvedere for over a year, and have found it perfectly adequate. The rooms vary from small to spacious (I have stayed in most of them!), but are all clean and comfortable. The staff are pleasant and helpful, the location is ideal for rail, tube and bus routes, and Paddington is a bustling area with a good range of shops, pubs and places to eat. The only drawback is the lack of a lift, which you feel if you are on the top floor, but this is more than made up for by the fact that a good breakfast is included in the room rate and, unlike many places, this is served from 6.30 so there is actually time to eat it before going to work. There are plenty of budget hotels in London, and I have stayed in more than I care to remember, but since finding the Belvedere I haven't looked anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good...”
Reviews.Author: jpnavarro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belvedere for around 8 nights and was quite impressed, since I didn't have high expectations in the first place... The hotel is very clean tidy, quite modern, and quiet. The English breakfast was good, it includes bacon, baked beans, eggs (scrambled or sunny-side-up) and sausages. There is also cereal (and milk), toast, butter, many jams, tea, coffee etc. The only thing that could have made the breakfast better was possibly some cheese or ham with the toast... The only bad thing about the hotel were the stairs, we were on the3rd floor. The final flight of stairs were quite steep. Not a problem for youths, but a troublesome feature for more mature people... The room also had some cracks in the walls and ceiling, but it is a 2* hotel after-all, so what would you expect? The room (Quad) was a decent size, and so was the bathroom... The bed-spreads, towels, etc were always clean, and there was also a kettle, mugs, milk, sugar, etc for making tea and coffee. The receptionist didn't speak much English, but did help the best he could when we needed... He is just a receptionist after all, not someone you sit down to have a chat with over a cup of tea. So that wasn't really a problem. Another thing which is a bit inconvenient but very safe at the same time is the fact that the door is always closed, so you'll ring the bell and he'll buzz you through... The hotel was literally 6 meters away from incoming buses, and only a corner away from outgoing buses. Paddington station is also a short walk away, and connects the most useful lines into London. The location is excellent, very safe at night since the area the hotel is in (Norfolk Square) is filled only with hotels and restaurants. The park is also very quite and relaxing after a long day sightseeing. There is also a close supermarket (Sainsbury's) in paddington railway station. A hotel worth staying in overall if you're looking for a quick pit-stop after a day sightseeing in London, for a cheapish price and central location...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in lovely area”
Reviews.Author: istvanmolnar
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in a lovely area, the underground is quite near. Beakfast is english or continental, delicious. Our room was although tiny, but clean and OK. Bathroom is pretty good, clean and modern. The bed could have been a bit more comfortable, but OK as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place but not the worse !”
Reviews.Author: 272scotty
Reviews.Content: Very noisy as had a room in the basement so heard the trains throughout the night - very little sleep ! Took payment off the card without asking ! as paying a different method or planned to ! That tired checked out early so could get home to bed to get a decent nights sleep - after paying Â£49.00 for a sleepless night not atall impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Motherhen84
Reviews.Content: First impressions were a grotty place. However we were desperate and needed to be near St Mary's Hospital. The rooms were clean and adequate the breakfast was included and was good. If you only need a roof over your head without paying a fortune this is the ideal place. Close to Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location and for convenient price.”
Reviews.Author: tomaz073
Reviews.Content: We were in family room for 5 person (two double bed and one single) , located in basement. The room was clean, the toilet and shower was o.k. The machine for hot water was o.k. and we used it to make tea and coffee. It was enough space to spend 4 days/nights in. You can hear the underground in the evening but for us this was not a problem. We slept without any problem. The breakfast was o:k: and the personal also.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel with rare room for 5”
Reviews.Author: Dij0
Reviews.Content: We had the room in the basement which accomodates 5 - compared well to a travel lodge with hair dryer and iron, plus tea/coffee making facilities. Decor is tired and no duvets just blankets but sheets and towels very clean as was the whole room. Rumble of the tube could be heard but no vibration and did not prevent sleep. We were warned to get to breakfast early, so we did at 07.45 and got a table easily - 15 mins later and there was a large queue. Breakfast was basic but plenty of it and staff extremely efficient and friendly. They kept coming out with more toast and we each got 2-3 slices of bacon on the plate (beans rather than mushrooms or tomatoes). Location of the hotel is brilliant - few minutes from Paddington and 30 seconds from bus stop (ask for St Mary's hospital). One of the best aspects was that they let us leave luggage at 10am before check-in and then the next day left it again after check-out until 3pm. Very convenient and good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good value,great location”
Reviews.Author: holsmanDoncaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belevere for 3 nights and i can say i was pleasantly suprised. The hotel is clean and although the rooms are on the small size, they have everything you would need. The breakfast is very good with very effeciant staff. The bathroom was very small but there was always plenty of hot water.The location of the hotel is very good with the underground station being very close by. I would stay here again as i was on a budget and this hotel offers good value for money in London.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: farggren
Reviews.Content: â€œWe really enjoyed our stay there before our cruise. Our group was treated so great and the night manager was wonderful even he helped us to carry the luggage the next day and served us breakfast had not really good but reasonable.The lady of the breakfast room. but any way Great people and great price! We will be back.â€� SWEDEN Note:We heared about the late arrival reviews but its our personal experienced that the man who is on the reception he welcomed every time even 3:00am in the late night, early morning. He behaved with us very helpful,even he is not from england but very good english .

Reviews.Title: “very good location,resonableprice,good service”
Reviews.Author: zindagihai_yeh
Reviews.Content: We were trying to book a room then we found a hotel name belvedere hotel.It is situated near by paddington station,once we entered ina hotel after mid night the night manager was very polite and he checked in very gently.The room he gave us very good it was on third floor ,A bit high but it was very good.breakfast was good even entire our stay was really wonder full.

Reviews.Title: “below "not too bad"”
Reviews.Author: fidelio82
Reviews.Content: The goods: The location of the hotel is definitely very good, very close (2 min walk) to Paddington underground station and train station, and there are 3 underground lines passing through. Also can be considered as close to Hyde Park, which will be an advantage for ppl who wanna do some running in the park. The shower and toilet was clean and was getting cleaned every day. The pillow is comfortable. The bads: The hotel has single rooms only at the basement and 5th floor and they said the only available one was the one at the basement which was really too bad. Even in sunny days, during the day the room was very dark. The room was very small, even too small. You should use the room only for sleeping but don't forget to take your ear plugs with you because you will have to listen to the noise of the trains all the time. I suggest you to take your towel with you as the one they give you smells like seasoned chips. The TV in the room has only 3-4 channels so if you will spend some time in the room don't forget to bring your laptop with you. The shower is too small, and the location of tap was wrong, you can easily touch the tap and boil yourself. The carpet was very dusty I am sure, and there were lots of mites in the room, possibly everywhere, I know because I am allergic to them and I kept sneezing whenever I was in the room, and not sneezing when I wasn't. No internet is available. I will definitely try my chance with another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: crazeefrog
Reviews.Content: The Belvedere is a great, no frills hotel located just steps from Paddington station. We stayed there as we had an early train to catch in the morning & wanted a cheap hotel that was close to the station. We got exactly what we wanted. The rooms were simple but clean. Breakfast was simple and absolutely fine (but definitely not "gourmet". We felt like we got good value for our money. Yes, the stairs were steep, so I would not recommend the hotel for the elderly or disabled. But for us (two able-bodied women in our forties) we were easily able to lug our bags up to the third floor. If you're looking for elegant or luxurious, you should pay the extra money & go somewhere else. But if you're looking for basic, clean, convenient at a reasonable price, the Belvedere would fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Joskeee
Reviews.Content: This is my third time that I went to London this year and this hotel was ok. The rooms have a normal space, breakfast is fine and the location was excellent. Only the staff couldn't or wouldn't help us at all. We wanted to book a trip, but he couldn't help us or even give us a tiny bit of information. That's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but bad experience & bad staff!”
Reviews.Author: DanishGirl19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights! The best things about this hotel were that it was cheap and it had a very good location - close to the bus and close to the underground. The room was pretty clean and the breakfast was ok. Bad things: there was a lot of noise during the nights, we were 4 people in the room and the bathroom was VERY small, the guy at the reception desk spoke much worse English than we did and he didn't much, one of the nights 2 of us came home late (around 4 or 5 AM), we went to our rooms and the guy at the reception desk saw us go to the room... then 5 mins after we got there the phone rang (which was very annoying because 2 of our friends were alseep) - it was the guy from the reception. He said that one of our friends was downstairs, but all of my friends were in the room, so I told him that and I said that we didn't know anyone else in London. Then 20 mins later he rang us again and said that our friend still was down there and asked if we wanted to pay for an extra room for him, and we said that we didnt know anyone... he was really annoying and kept talking about "our friend" and if we wanted to book another room. Next morning one of my friends was going home to Denmark so I took her to Victoria Station, when I came back he started talking about it again... He really acted mad, we checked out that day!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what You pay.”
Reviews.Author: Martez
Reviews.Content: Norfolk Square, being perfect base for a tourist. Belvedere is placed not so god, in the Park. Some rooms are rather noisy. Room standard and breakfast is about the same as in the other cheap hotels. Belvedere comes a little cheaper. But with the risk of getting the noise. (Continental is even cheaper. But that is quite another story.) Sadly enough, Belvedere misses to satisfy its main public, Young people at a thight budget, as the breakfast terminates far too early. You should come before 8.30, to be shure, to get the full meny.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy, WARNING!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megamange
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Except for the surrounding noises the staff switched off the heating every night and some hours during the day, which lead to freezing nights. We woke up at 4 am every night because of the coldness. Tried to talk to the staff in the reception but he denied turning off the heating. One day we asked for help to get a cab when the staff started arguing about the distance to our destination. When he finally called a cab, a relative to him showed up and drove us in his peronal car, charging overprice. Breakfast is included, but the dining room only fits one third of the guests- therefore a long queue in the morning. Feel really sorry for the breakfast ladies who have to deny people entry! We'll never return to this hotel ever again!!!! Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverBrussels
Reviews.Content: My stay in Belvedere hotel was really nice. The location is central, close to Paddington-tube (via the Bakerloo line only 10 minutes to Piccadilly Circus). It's located on a very nice and quiet square (Norfolk square), close to Hyde Park. My room was really ok. The bathroom was not that big, but included everything you need. One negative point: my room was on the fourth floor (so I had to do any steps). The breakfeast was ok (English breakfast). The service of the hotel staff was fine. I will recommend Belvedere hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: kayay
Reviews.Content: went to london on the 21st july for a james hunter concert at the arts theatre which coincided with the premiere of the dark knight, bonus! james hunter huge talent highly recommend him. stayed at the belvedere hotel, norfolk street paddington. it was basic but clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly. overslept and missed breakfast so cant comment on that. howerer, turn left and left again out of norfolk street and there is a fabulous little cafe called shaker. we had lunch there on the first day and breakfast the second. food was good and affordable and the staff were lovely. hi guys, thanks for the lovely warm welcome. norfolk street is a minutes walk from paddington station, good location. would definitely use the belvedere and shaker again.

HotelInfo.Name: The Belvedere
HotelInfo.Address: 52-54 Norfolk Square, London W2 1RT, England
